nodes.bodyText: Generate that JSON in a proper way, i.e. using JsonWriter.
Don't fetch anything in the constructor. Do that in onFetchPage().

Like this? 2139c58 (Oh, that broke a thing)
8209959
I don't think this improves the code quality as the code is now duplicate.
Not like that. It seems like you get the data in significantly different ways sometimes. I'll take a look soon.
@wb9688: I changed the BandcampChannelInfoItemExtractor as you suggested, as well as the other InfoItem classes, in 692b2d0. I hope it is what you had in mind.
Not needed with our nanojson fork
No need for the throws ParsingException then
Can't you use for (Object item : jsonArray)?

No, I can't; it would have to be for (JsonObject item : jsonArray) (because I then want to get a String from this JsonObject) and that is not possible because the Json parser doesn't know of what kind its array is.
This is as if I would replace getObject(i) with get(i), which returns an Object as well, not a JsonObject.
For YouTube, we do for (Object item : jsonArray) everywhere and just downcast i.e. item to a JsonObject
I changed it (9bc7a47); I do think the way I did is cleaner, but there's no need to argue about it…
I think you should still just return the actual ID in getId()
This would require querying the page, which I think would be better to avoid because the ID is not necessary.
There's no need to do this stuff…

I wrote this because I thought that in order for album URLs to work as IDs, they would always have to look the same, so that asking for the ID of the same URL twice would have to always yield the same result
YouTube channel IDs also aren't always the same. AFAIK we don't store IDs anywhere in NP, just URLs
Okay, I removed "URL cleanup" with e08256e.
No need for these variables
Use a
You should test all the public methods of a ChannelExtractor, and not call BandcampChannelExtractor directly.
I have BandcampChannelExtractorTest implement BaseChannelExtractorTest since 89b0639.
Shouldn't be public
I need to access this method in BandcampChannelLinkHandlerFactory to execute the same request in order to retrieve the URL from an ID.
Then put it in BandcampParsingHelper. An Extractor just isn't the place for that
Okay, I moved this method as well as getImageUrl(long, boolean) to the BandcampExtractorHelper class
Shouldn't be public
You should test all public methods of a KioskExtractor
What else is there to test? getPage(String) and getNextPageUrl() return null, getId() and getName() return the same value, namely "Featured".
You should test all public methods of a PlaylistExtractor, and test only one channel per (sub)class.
Is this how you imagine these tests to be? f71bd29
You should test all public methods of a KioskExtractor
You should test all public methods of a StreamExtractor
I added more tests to BandcampRadioStreamExtractorTests in e98bff8.
Remove this test. It should be handled by returning false in onAcceptUrl() in the appropriate LinkHandler
See above
Please implement this test in a similar way as YoutubeSearchExtractorTest currently does

Use the real date and compare if they are equal, not only the day

you should not do this, the content can change and 1 character less or more will break the change. You should test with Description.getContent().contains("Something that will probably never be edited");

where did you find this screenshot (I don't mean with the numbers at the left, but the original one).

It's a screenshot you can take with a bandcamp artist account when opening the preferences of a track. These are the only options you can select, I don't know a way to get 7.
use lexographical order please
why? isn't it because #279 is not yet implemented?

I wrote above:

Fan pages
Are extra work because they look different and don't really provide a lot of value I think

A fan page is a collection of items that a user (fan) has bought. It doesn't really make sense to implement them to me, and it might mislead users to think that a fan is the creator of the items in their account.
implement it
where is getUploadDate() ?

BandcampStreamExtractor is the superclass of BancampRadioStreamExtractor. It implements getUploadDate(), which uses the getTextualUploadDate() method to get the text date and parses it. The code would be the same for BandcampStreamExtractor as well as BancampRadioStreamExtractor, so I did not duplicate it.
remove this line
Which line? It's supposed to be a link, it needs to contain some text…

getSupportedCountries() is not overriden. For featured tracks, is there no personnalization based on countries?
Not that I knew about it, no. Featured tracks are also manually selected by Bandcamp staff and not automatically generated as far as I know.
Good catch. But that won't accept 10 Mar 2019 23:00:42 GMT or 16 May 2017 00:00:00 GMT

Setting the locale the US solves the parsing issue.

                        final Date date = new SimpleDateFormat("dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss zzz", Locale.ENGLISH).parse(textDate);
          
          
            
                        final Calendar calendar = Calendar.getInstance();
          
          
            
                        calendar.setTime(date);
          
          
            
                        return new DateWrapper(calendar, false);
          
          
            
                        final OffsetDateTime offsetDateTime = OffsetDateTime.parse(
          
          
            
                            textDate, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss zzz", Locale.US));

The ZoneOffset cannot be obtained. @Isira-Seneviratne Any idea?

Using ZonedDateTime instead of OffsetDateTime works, and the locale doesn't need to be set to US.
The ZonedDateTime can be converted using toOffsetDateTime().

Thanks for the help!
Are you located in an English speaking country? When running the method without setting the locale to ENGLISH or any English-speaking country, the month cannot be parsed. I implemented your suggestions in 74b46fe

@TobiGr @Stypox Do we really want this license line in every file?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+// Created by Fynn Godau 2019, licensed GNU GPL version 3 or later

nodes.bodyText: I don't know. I think they should either be in every file of the project or in none. I'd go with the latter since I don't see how they are useful and they are just a burden to maintain up-to-date.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+// Created by Fynn Godau 2019, licensed GNU GPL version 3 or later

nodes.bodyText: When code is not licensed, you are by default not allowed to use it. Therefore, the GNU GPL recommends to explicitly grant the license at the beginning of each file, making it extra clear that you are allowed to use it. Here I kept it extra short so that it only takes one line.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+// Created by Fynn Godau 2019, licensed GNU GPL version 3 or later

nodes.bodyText: I'd also keep the license.
